title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.8 - Evaluation criteria
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.8 - Evaluation criteria

State Regulations

The following are relevant to the division when determining
whether or not to approve an applicant as a certified provider of an alcohol
awareness program for youth: (a) Eligibility qualifications. The division shall consider whether the applicant
meets eligibility qualifications in accordance with section
343.5
of this Part; (b) Required endorsements. The division shall
consider: (1)
the endorsement of both the
program and the program provider by the local community service board; and
(2)
the endorsement of the
program by the local judge(s) or magistrate(s). (c) Learning objectives. The division shall
consider the extent to which the program meets the learning objectives of
section
343.6
of this Part as detailed in
the notice of requirements; (d) Target audience. The division shall consider the appropriateness of the program
for the intended audience. (e) Budget. The division shall consider the capability of the applicant to provide
the program within the submitted budget. (f) Fees. The division shall consider the
appropriateness and adequacy of the proposed fee and provision for fee
reductions. (g) Qualifications of
staff. The division shall consider the appropriateness and adequacy of each
staff member's qualifications, and the availability of qualified
staff. (h) Such other criteria as
the division designates. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14
ยง
343.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
